snippet: The United Nations cited witness reports of the sporadic use of chemical agents and stepped-up killings, with bodies strung up around Mosul....
abstract: United Nations human rights officials report that Islamic State militants have massacred scores of civilians in city of Mosul, Iraq, ahead of advance by Iraqi and Kurdish troops; UN also cites credible reports of group’s fighters’ using chemical weapons and chemical agents like chlorine gas against advancing Iraqi and Kurdish forces.

byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Erbil, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations cited witness reports of the sporadic use of chemical agents and stepped-up killings, with bodies strung up around Mosul.

headline.main: ISIS Is Massacring Mosul Civilians as Troops Advance, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: ISIS Is Massacring Mosul Civilians as Troops Advance, U.N. Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
